intro: Amsinckia retrorsa, commonly known as the desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system for water absorption. It produces small, round, greenish-brown seeds that are dispersed by wind. Amsinckia retrorsa is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is part of the Apiaceae (carrot) family.
